info.title: Checkout.com API Reference
info.description:
# Introduction
The Checkout.com API is built on HTTP. Our API is RESTful. It has predictable resource URLs.  It returns HTTP response codes to indicate errors.  It also accepts and returns JSON in the HTTP body.

You can use your favorite HTTP/REST library for your programming language to use Checkout's API, or you can use one of our SDKs (currently available in [PHP](https://github.com/checkout/checkout-php-library), [.NET](https://github.com/checkout/checkout-net-library) and [Java](https://github.com/checkout/checkout-java-library)).
# Authentication
When you sign up for an account, you are given a secret and public API key pair. You authenticate with the Checkout.com API by providing the appropriate key in the request Authorization header.

Never share your secret keys. Keep them guarded and secure.
<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description:
Webhooks are designed to notify your systems when certain/all registered events happen in near real-time.
They allow you to collect information about those events. Checkout.com can send these information via POST to an URL of your choice.

ApiKey.description:
When you sign up for an account, you are given a secret and public API key pair. Only public keys should be used in JavaScript or native applications. Any endpoints that allow public key authentication will be documented accordingly.
You can generate new API keys within the Checkout Hub.
ApiKey.name: Authorization

AccessForbidden.description: Access forbidden, invalid API-KEY was used

collectionFilter.name: filter
collectionFilter.description:
The collection items filter requires a special format.
Use "," for multiple allowed values.  Use ";" for multiple fields.
See the filter guide for more options and examples about this format.

collectionQuery.name: q
collectionQuery.description: The partial search of the text fields.

collectionSort.name: sort
collectionSort.description: The collection items sort field and order (prefix with "-" for descending sort).

collectionFields.name: fields
collectionFields.description: Limit the returned fields to the list specified, separated by comma.  Note that id is always returned.

collectionExpand.name: expand
collectionExpand.description: Expand response to get full related object intead of ID.  See the expand guide for more info.

rulesVersion.name: version
rulesVersion.description: The rule set version. Expand response to get full related object instead of ID.  See the expand guide for more info.

get.description: Retrieve a list of event types that you can be notified of using webhooks
Retrieves events ordered by the event date in descending order (latest first). Results can be paged by specifying the `skip` and `limit` query parameters.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: An ISO8601 formatted date and time to search from (default = last 6 months)

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: An ISO8601 formatted date and time to search to (default = now)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of events to return per page

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of events to skip

get.description: Retrieves the event with the specified identifier string. The event `message` includes the full event details, the schema of which will vary based on the `event_type`.
Retrieves the attempts for a specific event notification

post.description: Retries a specific webhook notification for the given event
Retries all webhook notifications configured for the specified event

Checkout.com supports payments from a variety of sources, from card payments to 
SEPA direct debits. The source of payment can be specified using the `source.type` field along with any source specific data.

To verify the success of the payment, check the `approved` field in the response.

### Reference Tokens

The most common way of making card payments is using a token generated by [Checkout Frames](#). 
This is mandatory for non-PCI compliant merchants as it ensures no card details are transferred to your server. 
This integration method also applies to digital wallets such as Apple Pay and Google Pay.

Note: Reference tokens expire after 15 minutes.

```json
{
  "source": {
    "type": "token",
    "token": "tok_ubfj2q76miwundwlk72vxt2i7q",
    "billing_address": { ... },
    "phone": { ... }
  },
  "amount": 5600,
  "currency": "GBP"
}
```

#### Full Card Details

To make a card payment specify the source type card.

Note that full card payments should only be requested by PCI compliant merchants.

```json
{
  "source": {
    "type": "card",
    "number": "4242424242424242",
    "expiry_month": 6,
    "expiry_year": 2018
  },
  "amount": 5600,
  "currency": "GBP"
}
```

### Existing Source

When a card payment is processed you will be returned a source identifier that can later be used to make payments. 
You can also add payment sources for Alternative Payments via the [Sources API](#tag/Sources).

```json
{
  "source": {
    "type": "id",
    "id": "src_wmlfc3zyhqzehihu7giusaaawu",
    "cvv" "843"
  },
  "amount": 5600,
  "currency": "GBP"
}
```

### Customer

You can provide the ID or email of an existing customer to make a payment using their default payment method.

```json
{
  "source": {
    "type": "customer",
    "id": "cus_y3oqhf46pyzuxjbcn2giaqnb44",
  },
  "amount": 5600,
  "currency": "GBP"
}
```

### Alternative Payments

Checkout.com supports a number of alternative payment methods. Reusable payment sources such as SEPA Direct Debits must first be created via the [Sources API](#tag/Sources).

For non-reusable payment methods such as those that use a redirect flow (e.g. iDEAL), provide the name of the payment method as the source.type along with any payment method specific data.

```json
{
  "source": {
    "type": "ideal",
    "issuer_id": "TESTISSUER01"
  },
  "amount": 5600,
  "currency": "GBP"
}
```

202.description: Payment asynchronous or further action required

get.description: Returns the details of the payment with the specified identifier string
Returns all the actions associated with a payment ordered by processing date in descending order (latest first).

post.description:
Captures a payment if supported by the payment method. 

For card payments, capture requests are processed asynchronously. You can use [webhooks](#tag/Webhooks) to be notified if the capture is successful.

Refunds a payment if supported by the payment method.

For card payments, refund requests are processed asynchronously. You can use [webhooks](#tag/Webhooks) to be notified if the refund is successful.

Voids a payment if supported by the payment method. 

For card payments, void requests are processed asynchronously. You can use [webhooks](#tag/Webhooks) to be notified if the void is successful.

Add a reusable payment sources that can be later used to make one or more payments. 
Payment sources are linked to a specific customer and cannot be shared between customers.

202.description: Payment source asynchronous or further action required

get.description:
Retrieves the payment source with the specified identifier string.

Some alternative payment sources such as SEPA may include additional links that provide
access to AP specific data and/or functionality.

post.description:
Exchange card details or a digital wallet payment token for a reference token that can be later used to request a card payment. 

**To create tokens please authenticate using your public key**

get.description: Retrieves the webhooks configured for the channel identified by your API key

post.description: Register a new webhook endpoint that Checkout.com will POST all or selected events to

409.description: Url already registered for another webhook

get.description: Retrieves the webhook with the specified identifier string

409.description: Url already registered for another webhook

patch.description: Updates all or some of the registered webhook details

409.description: Url already exists in another webhook configuration

country.description: The two-letter ISO code of the address country

EventLinks.description: The links related to the event

webhooks-retry.description: A link to retry all of the webhooks configured for the event

notifications.description: The notifications (e.g. webhooks) that have been sent for the event

content_type.description: The content type of the data sent to the endpoint

attempts.description: The notification events ordered by timestamp in descending order (latest first)

_links.description: The links related to the notification

retry.description: A link to retry the notification to the configured webhook

status_code.description: The HTTP status code returned from the target server

response_body.description: The response body returned from the target server

retry_mode.description: Whether the notification was sent automatically or requested manually

timestamp.description: The date/time the attempt was made

_links.description: The links related to the notification

downgraded.description: Inidicates whether this was a 3D-Secure payment downgraded to Non-3D-Secure (when `attempt_n3d` is specified)

enrolled.description:
Indicates the 3D-Secure enrollment status of the issuer
  * `Y` - Issuer enrolled
  * `N` - Customer not enrolled
  * `U` - Unknown

signature_valid.description: Verification to ensure the integrity of the response.

authentication_response.description:
Indicates whether or not the cardholder was authenticated
  * `Y` - Customer authenticated
  * `N` - Customer not authenticated
  * `A` - An authentication attempt occurred but could not be completed
  * `U` - Unable to perform authentication

eci.description: Defines the E-Commerce Indicator security level associated with the payment

cavv.description: Cryptographic identifier used by the card schemes to validate the integrity of the 3D secure payment data

xid.description: Unique identifier for the transaction assigned by the MPI

downgraded.description: Inidicates whether this was a 3D-Secure payment downgraded to Non-3D-Secure (when `attempt_n3d` is specified)

enrolled.description:
Indicates the 3D-Secure enrollment status of the issuer
  * `Y` - Issuer enrolled
  * `N` - Customer not enrolled
  * `U` - Unknown

BillingDescriptor.description: An optional dynamic billing descriptor displayed on the account owner's statement. [Read more](https://docs.checkout.com/reference/merchant-api-reference/complex-request-objects/dynamic-descriptor)

action_id.description: The unique identifier for the capture action

reference.description: Your reference for the capture request

payment.description: The URI of the payment to be captured. Use this to check the status of the payment

redirect.description: For some alternative payments, the URI that the customer should be redirected to, to complete the capture

amount.description: The amount to capture in the major currency. If not specified, the full payment amount will be captured

reference.description: A reference you can later use to identify this capture request

metadata.description: Set of key/value pairs that you can attach to the capture request. It can be useful for storing additional information in a structured format

Item.description: The order line item or product that is being purchased

sku.description: The stock-keeping unit identifier of the item

name.description: The name of the item or product

description.description: A description of the item or product
description.example: The fastest, hardest batterang known to man

image_url.description: The URL of an image of the item or product

price.description: The unit price of the item or product in the minor currency unit

quantity.description: The number of the items purchased

shipping_cost.description: The shipping cost of the item

shipping_tracking_url.description: A URL to track the shipping status of the item

requested_on.description: The date/time the payment was requested

currency.description: The three-letter ISO currency code of the payment

payment_type.description: Must be specified for card payments where the cardholder is not present (recurring or Merchant Offline Telephone Order)

3ds.description: Provides information relating to the processing of 3D-Secure payments

flagged.description: Whether the payment was flagged by a risk check

customer.description: The customer to which this payment is linked

id.description: The unique identifier of the customer. This can be passed as a source when making a payment

phone.description: The phone number associated with the shipping address

payment_ip.description: The IP address used to make the payment

destinations.description: For OpenPay payments, destinations determine the proportion of the payment amount credited to other OpenPay accounts

metadata.description: Set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a payment. It can be useful for storing additional information in a structured format

_links.description: The links related to the payment

actions.description: A link to the payment's associated actions

void.description: A link to void the payment, where applicable

capture.description: A link to capture the payment, where applicable

refund.description: A link to refund the payment, where applicable

reference.description: Your reference for the payment request

customer.description: The customer to which this payment is linked

redirect.description: The URI that the customer should be redirected to, to complete the payment

id.description: The unique identifier of the payment action

processed_on.description: The date/time the action was processed

auth_code.description: The acquirer authorization code for cards

metadata.description: Set of key/value pairs that you can attach to an action

_links.description: The links related to the action

response-code.description: A link to the full response code details

amount.description: The amount to be credited to the destination in the major currency unit

PaymentRecipient.description: Required by VISA and MasterCard for domestic UK transactions processed by Financial Institutions. [Read more](https://docs.checkout.com/reference/merchant-api-reference/complex-request-objects/visa-requirements-for-financial-institutions)

dob.description: The recipient's date of birth in yyyy-mm-dd format

account_number.description: The first six digits and the last four digits of the primary recipient's card, without spaces, or, up to ten characters of the primary recipient's account number

zip.description: The first part of the UK postcode for example W1T 4TJ would be W1T

last_name.description: The last name of the recipient

amount.description:
The payment amount in the major currency.
Omitting the amount or providing 0 will perform a card verification.

payment_type.description: Must be specified for card payments where the cardholder is not present (recurring or Merchant Offline Telephone Order)

reference.description: A reference you can later use to identify this payment such as an order number

capture.description: Whether to capture the payment (if applicable)

capture_on.description:
An ISO 8601 timestamp that determines when the payment should be captured. 
Providing this field will automatically set `capture` to true.

customer.description: Details of the customer associated with the payment

id.description:
The identifier of an existing customer. If neither customer `id` or `email` is provided
a new customer will be registered

email.description: An optional email address to associate with the customer

name.description: The customer's name. This will only set the name for *new* customers

phone.description: The phone number associated with the shipping address

3ds.description: Whether to process this payment as a 3D-Secure

attempt_n3d.description:
Determines whether to attempt a 3D-Secure payment as non-3DS 
should the card issuer not be enrolled.
[Read more](https://docs.checkout.com/getting-started/merchant-api/3d-secure-charges/attempt-non-3d-secure-charge) for more information.

skip_risk_check.description: Indicates whether risk checks for the requested payment should be skipped

success_url.description: For redirect payment methods, overrides the default success redirect URL configured on your account

failure_url.description: For redirect payment methods, overrides the default failure redirect URL configured on your account

payment_ip.description: The IP address used to make the payment. Required for some risk checks.

destinations.description:
For OpenPay payments, destinations determine the proportion of the payment amount that should 
be credited to other OpenPay accounts

metadata.description: Set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a payment. It can be useful for storing additional information in a structured format

type.description: The payment source type. With the exception of some alternative payment methods, this is inferred automatically

expiry_month.description: The two-digit expiry month of the card

expiry_year.description: The four-digit expiry year of the card

cvv.description: The card verification value/code. 3 digits, except for Amex (4 digits).

billing_address.description: The payment source owner's billing address

phone.description: The payment source owner's phone number

type.description: The payment source type. With the exception of some alternative payment methods, this is inferred automatically

id.description: The customer identifier, required if `email` is not provided

email.description: The customer email address, required if `id` is not provided

type.description: The payment source type. With the exception of some alternative payment methods, this is inferred automatically
The payment source type. With the exception of some alternative payment methods, this is inferred automatically

id.description: The payment source identifer for example, a card source identifier

cvv.description: The card verification value/code (for card sources). 3 digits, except for Amex (4 digits).

type.description: The payment source type. With the exception of some alternative payment methods, the `source_type` will be inferred automatically
The payment source type. With the exception of some alternative payment methods, this is inferred automatically

phone.description: The payment source owner's phone number. This will override the phone number specified during tokenisation

currency.description: The three-letter ISO currency code of the payment

3ds.description: Provides 3D-Secure enrollment status if the payment was downgraded to Non-3DS

flagged.description: Whether the payment was flagged by a risk check

customer.description: The customer to which this payment is linked

processed_on.description: The date/time the payment was processed

_links.description: The links related to the payment

actions.description: A link to the payment's associated actions

void.description: A link to void the payment, where applicable

capture.description: A link to capture the payment, where applicable

refund.description: A link to refund the payment, where applicable

response-code.description: A link to the full response code details

PaymentResponseCustomer.description: The customer to which this payment is linked

id.description: The unique identifier of the customer. This can be passed as a source when making a payment
The payment source identifier. Can be used for subsequent payments

billing_address.description: The payment source owner's billing address

phone.description: The payment source owner's phone number

last_4.description: The last four digits of the card number

fingerprint.description: Uniquely identifies this particular card number. You can use this to compare cards across customers

avs_check.description: The Address Verification System check result

customer.description: The customer to which the payment source is linked

id.description:
The identifier of an existing customer. If neither customer `id` or `email` is provided
a new customer will be registered

email.description: An optional email address to associate with the customer

name.description: The customer's name. This will only set the name for *new* customers

SourceResponseCustomer.description: The customer to which the payment source is linked

id.description: The unique identifier of the customer. This can be passed as a source when making a payment

version.description: Version information about the payment token. The token uses `EC_v1` for ECC-encrypted data, and `RSA_v1` for RSA-encrypted data.

data.description: Encrypted payment data. Base64 encoded as a string

signature.description: Signature of the payment and header data. The signature includes the signing certificate, its intermediate CA certificate, and information about the signing algorithm.

header.description: Additional version-dependent information used to decrypt and verify the payment.

expiry_month.description: The two-digit expiry month of the card

expiry_year.description: The four-digit expiry year of the card

cvv.description: The card verification value/code. 3 digits, except for Amex (4 digits).

billing_address.description: The payment source owner's billing address

phone.description: The payment source owner's phone number

billing_address.description: The payment source owner's billing address

phone.description: The payment source owner's phone number

last_4.description: The last four digits of the card number

issuer.description: The name of the card issuer

issuer_country.description: The card issuer country ISO-2 code

signature.description: Verifies the message came from Google. The signature is created using ECDSA.

protocolVersion.description: Identifies which encryption/signing scheme this message has been created. In this way, the protocol can evolve over time if needed. If it is not set, assume ECv0.

signedMessage.description: A serialized JSON string containing the encryptedMessage, ephemeralPublicKey and tag. To simplify the signature verification process, this value is serialized.

type.description: The type of card details to be tokenized
The type of card details to be tokenized

expires_on.description: The date/time the token will expire

self.description: The URI of the payment source

content_type.description: The content type to be sent to the webhook endpoint
